009package imagingbook.common.util;
010
011import java.awt.Toolkit;
012import java.awt.datatransfer.DataFlavor;
013import java.awt.datatransfer.StringSelection;
014import java.awt.datatransfer.Transferable;
015
016/** 
017 * Clipboard-related methods from
018 * http://examples.javacodegeeks.com/desktop-java/awt/datatransfer/getting-and-setting-text-on-the-system-clipboard/
019 * 
020 * @author WB
021 */
022
023public abstract class Clipboard {
024        
025        private Clipboard() {}
026        
027        /**
028         * Writes a string to the system clipboard.
029         * @param str some string
030         */
031        public static void copyStringToClipboard(String str) {
032                StringSelection stringSelection = new StringSelection(str);
033                Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getSystemClipboard().setContents(stringSelection, null);  
034        } 
035
036        /**
037         * If a string is on the system clipboard, this method returns it; otherwise it returns null.
038         * @return the clipboard string or null
039         */
040        public static String getStringFromClipboard() { 
041                String str = null;
042                Transferable trf = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getSystemClipboard().getContents(null); 
043                if (trf != null && trf.isDataFlavorSupported(DataFlavor.stringFlavor)) {
044                        try {
045                                str = (String) trf.getTransferData(DataFlavor.stringFlavor);
046                        }  catch (Exception e) {};
047                }
048                return str; 
049        }
050
051}
